Reviews.Title: “Not sure why one would choose to stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Kzw2
Reviews.Content: With so many hotel choices, I'm not sure why one would choose to stay here. A family member booked our stay otherwise I would not have. The rooms are very dark and dated so they don't feel very clean which is a big deal to me And the only reason I would not go back. The staff was nice, the pool was big (though the pool towels were tiny and scratchy), the grounds we grassy and well maintained and the hot breakfast included was a hit. I just really did not like the old look ad feel of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for team travel”
Reviews.Author: s0krm0m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with our soccer team. 16 14-year olds and several adults. The group reservation coordinator is excellent and went out of her way to take care of all our needs. Communication was excellent. The hotel was clean, rooms are spacious and the breakfast is wonderful We look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay”
Reviews.Author: oldsoccercoach
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 days at PHX-North and had a delightful stay. The room was what I expected - spacious living area and usual 2 queen bedroom. While bathroom was not something that a designer would love, it was more than adequate. Decor was older, but all was in good order. Breakfast was outstanding and the evening reception was a welcome respite. Stayed during Spring Training so the banter was raised a notch. Grounds are beautiful and large pool is the focal point. Only issue is that chairs are limited and go quickly in the am. Exercise room was ok. Not a gym, but sufficient to challenge anyone. Like other have written, stay away from the highway! Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Accomodating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TucsonAZMcBee
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to enjoy some great weather at. The gounds are pristine, pool is big with an outdoor bar close by and most importantly the rooms are very clean. We just stayed one night to see some friends that came in from OC to watch a Dodgers Spring Training game but we had the chance to take part in the free drinks and order some rooms service. The food was OK what you would expect of a typical hotel restaurant. The service was great, we asked for a late checkout on Monday morning and was told it was not a problem. If you are looking for a hotel for a little stay-cation this is a great spot for a family to relax for the weekend. Great pool and a lot of room for the kids to run and play in all of their courtyard space. We will return again, thank you to all the Embasy Suites staff for making our stay great. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Wound be awesome with an update”
Reviews.Author: ScholarGentleman
Reviews.Content: Very nice grounds, and friendly staff. But as others have noted, the rooms and furnishings are too dated. It seems like they are trying to improve the housekeeping, but the truths that with old (stained) furniture, linens, and carpets, it never quite feels clean. Just because of the hotel design, you hear everyone pass your room. Not too noisy during normal sleepy hours, though.

Reviews.Title: “Better than it looks!”
Reviews.Author: JudeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We decided to check out this hotel during our short stay for the Dodger's Spring Training. Highlights: The best complimentary bfest I've ever experienced! The 'manager's reception' is free happy hour with chips for two hours! And the room is spacious and has a door separating the bedroom and living space; including two tvs, a microwave, sink and mini fridge! Cons: It is about 25 mins away from our destination (Camelback Ranch). The location is right off the fwy. The only business nearby is a 7/11. Very limited dinner options: outside delivery & hotel room service. Room service comes from on-the-premises New Orleans styled resturant. I rcvd the 'buy far in advance' rate that is non-refundable. I wish I had booked three nights instead of two.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: Trooperr
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the usual Embassy Suites multi-story hotel with the interior courtyard / atrium, instead, this hotel looks like it "aged out" of another hotel's chain. The reception area / lobby are nice, up to date, impressive; the grounds are nice but not beautiful, the rooms are the weakest link! I was given a perimeter room facing the freeway where I backed my car right to the doorway (motel like). Upon entering if found a dated, stale smelling room. The bedroom chair cushion was heavily stained and carpeting was stained with what might have once been a gummy bear ground in for good measure. Upon vising the bathroom vaninty area, a very large (4"x4") ball of hair on the floor greeted us. How housekeeping missed seeing it, I don't know (I reported this to the night desk clerk who noted it but no one contacted me for follow up). The beds and bathroom were clean. Overall, I would not stay there again, I would opt for a nicer hotel. I had alway viewed the Embassy Suites chain as one of quality and would not give a second thought to staying at one of their hotels; I can no longer make that assumption.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BSU82
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge, the breakfast is wonderful, grounds and pool are nice, staff friendly and helpful. Yes, not everything is updated yet but neither is my house lol! Nice stay, comfortable quiet rooms, can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Once a Jem, now more like coal in my Christmas Stocking.”
Reviews.Author: johnydolittle
Reviews.Content: Please read my review of the Embassy Suites Scottsdale, such a better place. I lived in Phoenix for 10 years and have stayed at this property a few times and been to a few events there. Right as I walked in the door, I regretted moving to this property from the Scottsdale Embassy Suites. There wasn't a soul to be found other than a guy at the rental car counter with his feet on the desk playing with his phone. They did have a little bell on the counter.. Ring Ring....The girl at the counter was pleasant, made a comment she was new. I asked about a bellman and was told they don’t have any? Don't have any? Hmmmmmmmm......More than 3/4 of the rooms are on the 2nd and 3rd floor with limited access to an elevator. So, if you are older or traveling with kids it’s a big pain to haul your luggage up several flights of stairs. My dad is in a walker so I have no clue how he could have stayed here. Anyway, the room wasn't bad; it was clean just a tad outdated. Typical, 2 room suite with fridge, sink and a microwave. Couches and chairs were rater uncomfortable....Bed was a bed…… I called housekeeping arounf 9am when I was going out for the day and asked for my room to be cleaned so that when I return with guests it’s, well, clean…lol Returned at about 4 pm and room was never serviced. I called and a lady showed up 20 mins later, nice lady just don’t like to be in the room when they are cleaning it. I still tipped her. Breakfast was pretty good, but the wait for an omelet was too long so we just ate the pre-cooked eggs and bacon…. The area is sketchy, hotel is just off the I 17 in North Phoenix. If you are looking for a place to lay your head for a day at most this place will do, however this is not were you want to stay to enjoy Phoenix on a vacation. You can email me for other options. The grounds were well maintained. Pool looked nice and was heated. Room service is a disgrace and I am being kind here. From the order taker, to the chef, to the delivery guy. ALL INCOMPETENT…..We ordered room service and paid $16 to watch a movie, yes $16 dollars…LOL….So, I ordered a filet medium-well,( yes I know, however it is how I like it). They have 2 sizes of filet, the guy on the phone never asked me what size, they offer different sauces, never asked me what kind, they offer different sides, never asked what type. So after I did his job for him the food comes and we are missing a salad. The waiter runs back to get it and brings it back. In addition, my steak is rare. Instead of complaining my friend offered to switch her entrée with mine, she had ribs which were pretty good. What’s the big deal? The next night we ordered again, again the same idiot on the phone. I informed him that my steak was undercooked last time and gave him explicit instructions MED WELL NO PINK, I even told him top butter-fly it if need be. So the guy brings the food and says “Can you check your steak before I leave” So all I had to do was touch the top and could tell it was AGAIN rare. He says to me how can you tell without cutting into it….Oy Vey….So I cut into it and wahla RARE. So this guy takes the tin top from the room service plate, stabs my steak with a fork and plops it in the tin top and says he will be right back. Are you kidding me? 20 mins latter he returns with only the steak, no mashed potatoes or veggies….Hmmmmmm, was I supposed to keep them warm in my microwave? At this point I am done with them. To my amazement they steak is still undercooked. I call back and tell them that it’s still undercooked and I am not paying for it. 40 mins later he’s knocking on my door to pick up the steak because the manager needs proof in order to take it off my bill….What a joke. The high points were a few of the staff members. A girl who works at the restaurant noticed us waiting for the bar to open at 4 and the bartender was late so she got the keys and made us some drinks, very nice of her as she could of easily just said she works at the restaurant or ignored us. She is a big Steelers fan. When I went to go print out my boarding passes early in the morning, none of the computers were working and this guy turned his monitor towards the counter and gave me the keyboard and mouse to print them out. 2 shining stars out of a bunch of incompetent people.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: Tazman57
Reviews.Content: We were greatly disappointed when we got to our room. It was very outdated and looked cheap almost like mobile home (trailer) quality. The room rate of $125 per night significantly higher then the Hyatt Place at $98 per night. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Families but bad for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Lune
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are very nice, with several swimming pools and other good amenities for a family. The pool was wonderful for kids. Its very large and never gets deeper then 5 feet. However, the rooms are outdated and poorly set up for business. There is no wireless connection in the rooms, and the wired connection is set up on the other side of the room from any available plugs. The Ethernet cable they provided didn't even work; and given the number of devices these days that is wireless only, this is unacceptable. There is WiFi in the lobby. The included breakfast is impressive with an omelette's bar and several options each day. However, there is little variation, and it got old after three days. We did not try the restaurant at any other times of day. All and all this hotel is a mixed bag. If you are looking for a family hotel and can take advantage of some of the online deals, this might be a good value. However, I would not recommend this hotel for a business traveler; or at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expect from Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: rossclan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we have Hilton Honors. The hotel grounds were very nice, and they upgraded our family to a suite. VERY nice! However, the room was very outdated. The master only had a bath tub. The hotel only has wi-fi in the lobby and the ethernet connection in the room didn't work. Thank goodness for smart phones. Very inconvenient. All the room are accessed from the outside similar to a motel. One strange thing happened. We left the do not disturb sign on the door as I had left all my valuables in the room and my kids were starving. So we went quickly to eat breakfast. Upon our return, our room was cleaned and the do not disturb sign was inside. Why in the heck did they enter? Luckly, everything was intact, but, the whole thing really bugged me.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: rleland
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites is not your usual quality Embassy Suites facility. The lobby, pool, and interior grounds are wonderful, but the rest of the facility is very outdated for an Embassy Suites, including rooms. The hotel is very large with long walks everywhere. Parking fairly close to rooms, but if carrying large items or rolling large baggage, elevators are few and far between. The ice machines (2 that I tried) were not working on the third floor of buildings 4, 5, or 6. No "out of order" signs either so I had to walk around to find a working machine. The walkways are pebble coated, cracked, and dirty. The room was spacious, but in need of remodeling. Carpet and furniture old and outdated. Rooms on the west side of facility next to I-17 a little noisy, but double pane windows cut-out most of the noise. I'm a light sleeper, and had no problem because the bed was so comfortable as usual. Linens and bath towels clean and toiletries plentiful as I expected from an Embassy Suites. The decor just didn't meet up with all the other Embassy Suites we've experienced. The food at the Manager's social, breakfast, and hotel restaurant all average. Hotel staff courteous and friendly. I would stay at this facility again, but would look for other Hilton brands first in the Phoenix area. This facility just didn't live up to what I expect from an Embassy Suites or Hilton brand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More like a motel than Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: truprunbike
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel one night for Business. I have stayed at countless Embassy Suites because they are always of similar class. This one did not live up to that level of class I expect. It was really just a nice motel. When I drove in, I thought it looked great. Check in was quick and the appearance of the lobby was outstanding. Then I had to get back into my car and drive around the building to the back. That’s when I realized all the entry doors are exterior doors like a budget motel. Get to my room, and it was pretty large but the carpet and furniture was dated. Breakfast was similar to other Embassy Suites, but not as large of a selection as most and it bugged me that most of the hot foods you had to wait in line for. They did not have a hot serve yourself station of scrambled eggs or pancakes. Everything was cooked to order, which made getting seconds too timely. Still better than most places though. Workout facility was tiny. While the rate did seem fairly cheap and economical, I would not be staying here again for business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: tawny07
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel as a great value on Hotels.com as a last minute special. The check in was a breeze. Our room was dark as others have stated, but very clean and comfortable with a refrigerator and microwave in the room which we always find convenient. The bed was super comfortable. The grounds were very nice with a huge round pool and a very warm jacuzzi. The managers reception was a wonderful treat. If you tip the bartender well, he'll just keep them coming. The full breakfast buffet was a real treat, not like the chintzy ones at most hotels. They had a great omelette bar and fresh French Toast made on the same flat-top. We stayed 2 nights and slept great! No traffic noise or noise from other rooms and it was a busy weekend with Taylor Swift at the Jobing.com arena and the Steelers vs. Cardinals game the next day. Also a couple of weddings going on.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, convenient (no bed bugs)”
Reviews.Author: bbkimTucson
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at this property, and it was exactly as it was the previous stays. Two earlier reviews stated they had encountered bed bugs here, but we found no evidence of them. Also management said they had thoroughly gone over the property so that gave us a tad more confidence. We like this place, dark rooms are a plus in hot-as-hell Phoenix, and the breakfast buffet is fairly nice. It's comfortable and large enough to spread out in, except we couldn't find luggage racks so used two chairs instead. We like Lafitte's, the onsite restaurant as well. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl5555
Reviews.Content: When you first enter the lobby of this hotel, you think you are in a 4- or 5-star hotel. The lobby is gorgeous. The free breakfast in the morning is very nice with a good omelet station. Those are the highlights. Our room was clean, but as others have commented, it was dark and someone dated. It also had a strange musty smell - at first we thought that someone had smoked in the room but this odor was more moldy. The bathroom (toilet/tub) area was very small - it reminded us of a cruise ship. The internet in the room was wired and a bit slow, but at least is functioned, unlike the internet at the business center which was being repaired when my husband went to print out our boarding passes. Thank goodness that they had an online printing program so we could print from our laptop onto the Business Center's computer. The pool area was okay, but there was no one attending to the pool and my husband got the last pool towel. All-in-all it was an average experience.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly”
Reviews.Author: chucx
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites is well-known by the business community, but the managers reception, complimentary breakfast and large swimming pool are great assets for family fun on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Disgusted18
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be a great experience. I have always stayed at Embassy Suites...Albuquerque, San Antonio, Anaheim, Canada...but this will be my last here in Phoenix!! The Embassy Suites seemed fine at first. The lobby and swimming pool gives a false sense that this hotel is at the Embassy level. Our room was dark with a musty smell. Very outdated...the air conditioning was not working properly and the carpet has a stain on it. The towels did not look very clean..My wife was placing my 2 year old in bed when we saw a red bed bug crawling towards my daughter..I wasn't even sure what it was at first since until I researched on the net. Horrible!! I called the front desk and and complained...they didn't sound surprised.. they offered me another room, but it was very late so I stayed...I checked everywhere for more bugs...just found a lot of stains and dirt. The entire hotel should be exterminated...awful...I would not recommend this hotel to my enemies...

Reviews.Title: “Horrified & undecided.......”
Reviews.Author: elalah
Reviews.Content: We always stayed at Embassy Suites when we are in the Phx area and even recommended it to other family members as well. Although, I was VERY disappointed with our recent, one-night stay at the hotel. I found a BUG in my bed!!!!!!!! It was 2am and I was getting ready for bed; ready to lay down, I moved my pillow and there it was!!! A small, not so tiny bug started crawling toward the corner of the bed. It had to be 5 cm long, I could see its legs moving, and it had black stripes on its back/butt or whatever. I do not know if it was a bed bug because I never encountered that situation before, so before killing it I took a picture for my record. The picture did not come out to well because it was small and I couldnt capture it well. So afterwards, terrified and shaken, I looked at the corner of the bed and there were stains on the sheet. Disgusted because it looked like they were dark stains, possibly from a bloody finger or something, the stains weren't too large or small, and the sheets even looked like they were put on inside out. This was a horrible experience!!!! So, I called the front desk and the guy offered me to look at other rooms. Security came and showed me another room. I went straight to look at the beds and there on top of the sheets was a small spider!!!!!!!!! Maybe because the room was unoccupied and it was about 2:30am now the insects were out!? Disheartened now I wanted to check out but was sooooooo tired, I just ended up looking at a 3rd room with Security. Security thankfully took apart the bed, moving the sheet, pillows, mattress and all to make sure there were no bugs and it looked clean...enough. So, my girls and I packed up and went into the 3rd room (my BF was at the casino this whole time). By then it was past 3am and I could NOT go to sleep. Even though Security did a bed check I was traumatized that there might be bed bugs!!! I never had this experience staying at Embassy Suites before and was SO sad because my daughter loves the pool area and my BF loves the complimentary breakfast. I am not sure that we will stay there again because basically my worst fear came true of staying in hotels (bed bugs- possibly?). Thankfully we were not charged for the one-night stay and our phone charger that I forgot in our first room was brought to us the following day. Overall, I just REALLY want to forget this experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Property - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: G-momABQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a baseball tournament with our whole team. They gave us a great group deal. The property is beautiful and the hotel offers a lot of perks. There is a nice breakfast offered every morning and not just your boring continental fare. They would make you fresh omelets or eggs any style you wanted, fresh pancakes or french toast most morning, etc. There was also an awesome happy hour each evening where you could get free "adult beverages" and munchies of 2 hours. The pool was very large and the kids loved it (rough bottom, so water shoes are recommended to prevent blisters). I would have like to have more towels at the pool though. One afternoon, my husband and kids had to come back to the room without drying off because there were no towels. All the service was great - front desk, housekeeping, cooks. We will definitely stay there again when we're in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby & rooms near pool great; all others terrible”
Reviews.Author: CaptainJack58
Reviews.Content: When I lived & worked in Phoenix, I had the opportunity to select a hotel for out of town visitors to stay in & I toured this facility. I was shown the lobby, meeting rooms & the newest rooms near the pool. My company sponsored many meetings at this place. So after I moved to the East Coast, when I traveled back to Phoenix for a pleasure trip, I chose this place. I was stuck in an ancient room at the back of the property. It looked like a cheap, rent-by-the-week motel room. There was water on the bathroom floor. The carpet was old. The furniture was bare bones. It did NOT compare with the rooms at the front of the hotel. I asked to move, but was told that there was no availability.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: steverk1
Reviews.Content: I can understand why there are so many bad reviews about this hotel. It is very different than any other Embassy Suites I’ve seen and it is older. However, I’ve always loved this hotel and this last stay was better than average. First, let me explain how this hotel is unique. The locals tell me it was originally built as a hotel called “The Fountains.” Unlike most Embassy Suites, it was built as a low rise building centered on an outdoor recreation area. This includes an outstanding pool, lighted tennis court, deck and pavilion for special events. Facilities also include a workout room, laundry, and beautiful lobby. Consistent with its original name, there are several fountains on the property. Access to all rooms is via outside corridor. I prefer this arrangement to the typical Embassy Suites, which is usually based on the idea that all beauty is manmade. This hotel has gorgeous park like grounds that I really appreciate. Moving on to the specifics of my stay: my room was recently remodeled with fresh paint, new furniture, and new carpet. This was a big improvement over the room I had last year. The bathroom was very small, but it was in good shape and was adequate. (Note: the rooms on the west side of the hotel are larger and have much larger bathrooms) The desk staff was always courteous and helpful. The breakfast was outstanding even by Embassy Suites standards. I highly recommend this hotel and hope you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money, go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: MarinersFan17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March 2011 for Spring Training. I will start with the good things about this hotel... Nothing. The bad things just pile up. First of all, what kind of hotel doesn't have Wi Fi in the rooms in 2011? There is wired internet in the rooms, but many computers don't even have the ports for wired internet anymore! Wi Fi is available in the lobby, but only if you can find a clean place to sit during or after free happy hour. The lobby is not cleaned until about noon, and happy hour is a 5pm the day before. If you try to do any sort of work in the lobby during happy hour, it is like trying to do work in a fraternity party. Not everyone can get away from school work or business, even when they're on vacation. Also in the lobby, there are three to five computers for visitor use if you want to print boarding passes or check flights, email, whatever. Don't even bother using this computers. The ones in the lobby are so slow, I eventually gave up after 30 minutes waiting for pages to load. The ones in the business center have sticky keyboards that don't work well enough to really do anything. The pool is disgustingly dirty and during our stay (we've been at this hotel several times now, all in March) it is constantly full of screaming children and teenagers. The hot tub is not patrolled so if you want to relax in a nice, warm hot tub, good luck doing that here. Even late at night, the tub is full of kids. And thats if you can find somewhere clean to put down your clothes, books, or towels. The towel supply at the pool is almost always empty, might want to bring towels from your room. Free breakfast is nice, but only if you get there around 7am. Get there at 9am and you'll be fighting about 300 people to get food. Good luck finding a table to sit at. The one time I chose to brave the crowds, I had to sit at a dirty table, next to other people's half eaten foods. I know it can get busy and its hard to keep things clean, but maybe this hotel should consider hiring more personnel for the month of March. There is always food plates sitting in the walkway to the rooms, sometimes even as late as 7 or 8pm (and these are obviously breakfast plates, not from dinner). Gross. Road noise is horrendous and even when we asked to be moved to a room closer to the lobby (two of the people in our party were disabled and we were given a third floor room at the very end, probably a quarter mile from the lobby and pool) we were denied. Failure in the customer service department. I would recommend you stay somewhere else. This place is a waste of money and you'll spend more time cleaning up after other people just to enjoy the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but so NOISY with traffic noise”
Reviews.Author: Sandy592
Reviews.Content: Loved the breakfast. Room was a spacious suite, with 2 flat screens. The problem is that this hotel is located directly on interstate 17 and local Greenway Blvd. The traffic noise in our room was deafening. Our room was located on the outside corner of Hwy 17 and Greenway Blvd. It felt like the trucks were drving in our room. Others in our party had courtyard rooms and loved their stay. We arrived before anyone else in our party, and were given a nasty room location. The room was excellent, the location was terrible. Pool area was tropical in feeling. WiFi is free. If I had a nice room location, I would recommend this hotel to everyone. If I go again, I would stay here only if I had a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Amazing Cooked to Order Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Forwarder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at this Embassy Suites in Phoenix we loved it and would stay there again if circumstances permitted. Our room was clean and very quiet. The breakfasts were superb, I had “made to order” omelets every morning, they were as good as any I have ever had. Happy Hour was nothing special, the drinks were fine but the appetizers were pretty lousy. Our second night we just ordered room service and went to the bar to get our “Happy Hour” drinks and back to our room to enjoy them. We did notice the hotel is upgrading all their rooms with new carpeting so this might explain some of the negative complaints from others about the condition of the rooms. Our room did not have the new carpeting yet but that did not affect our stay, we enjoyed our time there, the pool, and the hot tub were also great.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Embassy Suites Ever”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine084
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites should be embarrassed to call this an Embassy Suites. We planned to stay 5 nights at $135 a night but checked out after the first night. The first suite they showed us was dark, dingy with soiled carpeting that was ragged. I asked for a change, after showing me 3 other ones, we got a suite with new carpeting. But the suite is old, dark and depressing, no natural light. The bathroom (toilet and shower/tub) was so small, you could barely turn around in it.. The noise from the upstairs room where kids were staying was so disturbing, we had to call the front desk 3 times. The laundry room had 2 washers, one broken and very old dryers that took forever to dry. The only thing nice about this place is the pool which was beautiful. I've stayed at many Embassy Suites before but this one is the worst. I would never recommend this one to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service for an overpriced, outdated dump of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerAZ999
Reviews.Content: Spent only one night here before checking right back out. Front desk people acted bored and like we were wasting their time. Tried to call front desk from room to ask about services and spent 10 minutes on hold and when I finally got through, was told by the clerk "I'm the only one up here and I'm busy! You need to hold." Room looks like a cheap throwback to the 70's. For a suite, the bathroom is ridiculously tiny, and you could hear people in the room upstairs every time they flushed their toilet. The thermostat in the room is from the 60's and looks battered to pieces. No electrical outlets in rooms barely, towels are cheap and rough feeling. The suite overall was very shabby looking for what they charged and is not what I would ever call a "suite". We were supposed to be in a block of rooms with a group of ours at the hotel and they put us in a room at the opposite end of the place instead! We had a buffet meal for our group and the servers couldn't even tell us what some of the dishes were! One looked like wallpaper paste with bits of charcoal in it. We were served only iced tea - you had to go up and ask for water or a soda, which I think is ridiculous. The one bar area even charged for water! I went to check out in the morning and no one was at the front desk. A line had formed and others were calling out to see if anyone was around and finally, the manager sauntered out, looking bored and like we were bothering him. He never apologized or anything. I checked out and got my reciept. Went home and got online to look at my bank account/debit and saw they'd triple charged me on the room. Had to call 4 times to get the money credited back as they kept sending me to voicemail and finally admitted the accounting person wasn't even in the office that day! I will NEVER go back to that dump again and would not recommend it to anyone. There are several other hotels/motels right down the street from there that would be much better to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: pm2006
Reviews.Content: Our wedding party booked 33 rooms and everyone of them was clean as appealing. The furniture was free from holes and the tubs and sinks were very clean. (just addressing an earlier posters comments) We all managed to get a room that faced the courtyard, That was definately a plus. The Southwest ambiance of the place made it feel more like a resort than a hotel. The breakfast was the best i ever had from a hotel (free or not). The managers reception included top shelf liquor! The pool area was quite large and clean as well. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and cocktails included!”
Reviews.Author: margio1224
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend. The suite was quite spacious, it was nice having a 2 room suite with the separate bedroom and living room. The only complaint I have is that there is no door separating the bedroom from the area of the bathroom where the sink is, so there is no privacy if you want to get dressed while somebody else is in the bedroom, and it would be a lot more convenient to have 2 sinks in the bathroom instead of only 1, especially when traveling with a family. The suite has a small kitchen area with a microwave, coffee maker and fairly large fridge, good for families with kids that want to store drinks and snacks. The breakfast included with the room rate is fabulous. You have a choice of made to order omelletes, pancakes, French toast (varies each morning), a buffet with eggs, sausage etc and a variety of cereals as well as fruit, muffins, coffee etc. The cocktail hour is an extra perk, 2 hours of complimentary drinks and snacks. We did not notice any restaurants near the hotel, we had to find a fast food place the night we arrived, the hotel restaurant closes at 10pm. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here, very comfortable and good value.

Reviews.Title: “How could anyone not love this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: ABQDaddio
Reviews.Content: Killer price (admittedly it was summer in Phoenix), great pool, superb free breakfast, lovely Southwest architecture throughout the hotel with lots of space, and a very nice feel and flow. AC could have been a little colder, but it was certainly OK, and it was pretty nice considering it was 105 degrees outside. Suite layout is fantastic. It spoils the business traveler accustomed to a single room, and it is just perfect for a small family. This is a great hotel. For business and pleasure, everyone I know that goes to Phoenix stays here. I am baffled how anyone could not love it - I am sure it is possible for things to go wrong, but they have always gone great for me over several business trips and one with family.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and Dirty... Wish we'd stayed elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: krommec
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I went to Phoenix for a business trip/vacation. Our first impressions of the hotel were good -- nice entrance, pretty lobby, well kept courtyard. We were surprised by the motel layout as that's not what we expect from an Embassy Suites. The room was less than desirable. We expected a well appointed, clean room. We got a dark, dingy, outdated and moldy room. The furnishings were old and worn out. There was visible mold and mildew in the shower which is awful for my husband's allergies. My husband complained to the management and since he is HHonors Gold they moved us to their "executive" suite, promising that they'd have Housekeeping check it before we moved rooms. This room was bigger but not any better. There was tons more mildew in the shower. When we got to the room, it had 3 inches of standing water in the jacuzzi tub. It strangely had two AC Units and only one worked. The faucet fixture in the tub was so caked in minerals it was clear that no one had been cleaning it. As for other parts of the hotel, the restaurant had tears and crumbs on the bench seating. The staff couldn't keep up with the demand for pool towels (with less than 25 guests in the pool area) and the poolside drinks were overpriced. The front desk staff had very little to offer for dining suggestions. The elevator was old, dirty and scary. We will not stay here on future trips. It was very obvious that the management doesn't hold housekeeping to any standards. It was hard for me to understand how in an arid area like Phoenix a bathroom could have so much mold and mildew.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: 4DesertTravelers
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for three rooms a month in advance of my brothers wedding. I know that Phoenix hotels fill up early because March is baseball Spring training season. I requested early check in (knew that might be tricky) and that all our rooms face the courtyard. After a long drive we arrived in Phoenix around 1:30 and were advised that our rooms were not ready and to come back at 3. We had a nice lunch at the onsite restaurant and strolled around the grounds until 3 pm when it was time for check-in. We were told our rooms were not ready and to come back in 15 minutes. Fifteen minutes later we were told that our rooms were still not ready and to come back in 30 minutes. They kept using the excuse that the hotel was fully booked due to baseball Spring Training. Finally at 4 pm were received keys to one of our rooms. We went to that room only to find that it was on the exterior of the hotel, next to a busy freeway and a maintenance man was inside the room advising us that he needed to change the air conditioning unit. Going back to the front desk I was told by a front desk clerk that "the hotel is full and this is just the way hotels work" as if I have never travelled before. Finally by 4:15 we had keys to all rooms. The rooms were adequate but after 3 minutes of hot water in the shower the water turns cold, extremely cold. The carpets are old and need replacing and beware of the quick downslope in the floor as you enter the room. The grounds of the hotel are well maintained and the free breakfast the next morning is very good. Baseball Spring Training happens every year in Phoenix and the management of this hotel should not use it as an excuse for extremely poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and clean and roomy”
Reviews.Author: langelino
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was in a Wedding being held at the hotel. The room was nice and clean, the pool area was great as was the hot tub. The towels at the pool were a little small, be sure to grab two. DO NOT MISS THE BREAKFAST- the omelet station was great, and the breakfast selection was really good. I didn't eat any other meals at the hotel other than the wedding reception food which wasn't all that good. I did have a problem with the Alamo rental car desk at the hotel though. I reserved a car for a week, I checked at 2PM when I reserved it and they said they didn't have it ready... I kept checking back until 4:30pm when I said I couldn't wait anymore and they gave me a pickup truck for the first day, I told them I needed a car for the next day as I needed to take passengers to the wedding, the next day they told me they had nothing available and told me to drive the truck to the airport and switch it for a car there, as I had to be at the wedding, and had been very polite up until this point, I got a little angry with them and suddenly a car appeared for me, they also knocked $100 off my rental for my troubles, I find it annoying when being polite gets you nowhere, and when you start raising your voice a little all of the sudden things go your way, it really shouldn't be that way....

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: notravelsurprises
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel from TripAdvisor with proximity to baseball spring training camps, and ability to use Hilton points. We checked in around 11 PM, went to our room, and thought we'd wandered into the wrong hotel! No where close the the Embassy Suites we've stayed in all over the US! Furniture was rippped, no computer desk, closet door broken, phone and light cords strung along the walls, electrical outlets so old that plugs fell out! About all the good I can say about it is that it was clean. For the second time in my long years of travelling both for pleasure and business, I called the desk and asked for another room. The desk clerk apolgized and ended up giving us a handicap accessible room (he said the hotel was completely booked), which worked out OK. The next day, the manager called to apologize, saying they'd taken the 1st room out of service, and offered us a free movie. This is an older hotel -- appears to have been built in sections. Be sure to ask for an inside-facing room as it sits right on the Interstate. For breakfast, a chef cooks made to order omlets and alternates between pancakes and French toast. Otherwise the breakfast seemed a little below other Embassys -- no whole fresh fruit, pastries were strictly Hampton Inn fare. They have Starbucks Coffee in the breakfast area, but you have to buy it -- the cheap stuff is free. Room service was OK. Grounds are well kept and staff to a person was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: nyrs1994
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler I make sure I am selective when I travel for pleasure - I have been to this hotel numerous times - It is outstanding in every aspect and the staff are second to noe in their hospitality and professionalism. The rooms were clean - the breakfast was great - The gym was tremendous, clean with all machines in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff and the Cleaniness of this Place was really bad”
Reviews.Author: boyerbrown
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels before; I would rank this number 2 as the worst I have ever stayed. The cleanliness of the room was really bad (found battery and cell phone cover under the bed. TV volume was programmed too low it took maintenance 2 hours to check and fix. The next day the Movie channel was not working this time it took the maintenance 3 hours to tell me that there is nothing they can do. For the price I paid I would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: airedale7734
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I was quite nervous about our stay, but we were with a group for a sporting event. We were pleasantly surprised. The grounds and the lobby were very nice. Our room was fine. It could use a little updating, but it was certainly adequate. I wonder if the rooms vary considerably depending on which building you are in. The breakfast was quite good with made-to-order omlettes. We didn't have the terrible crowds that we always have at the Seattle Embassy. The manager's reception is a nice perk too if you are around at the right time.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a few days on a recent business trip. I thought it was ok. It's nothing fancy. The rooms are minimally furnished but clean. The staff were very friendly and offered assistance whenever I needed something. The grounds were well kept. The one major drawback was the breakfast. Pretty much everything I had was yuck. I think it's generally an ok place. Not bad if your just passing through and want a clean and roomy place to stay that's convenient to North Phoenix and other points North. I wouldn't stay here on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible front desk Old Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bmo218
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June on Business only to recieve terrible service by the front desk that was plain rude. The first room they gave us had cig burns, so we moved to another room. The rooms are not up to the standard other Embassy's. The plus side was the breakfast and the workout room. Cant stress enough how terrible the women at the front desk were. This place is alright for a night if its the last place in town.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanandKevin
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night here on the last day of our trip. I chose the location because it's pretty convenient to get to the airport and is in the north part of town, which is convenient if you're going to or coming from Sedona. Staff here were very nice. Our room was just OK -- when we arrived there was a tray of dirty dishes right outside our door. I called room service and they took care of it promptly. The carpet was dirty and pretty gross. I wore flip flops so I wouldn't have to walk on it. One of the beds had what appeared to be a pretty good sized burn hole on the bedspread. Other than that, the room looked clean. Manager's reception (free drinks & snacks from 5:30 - 7:30) and breakfast buffet were included. Reception was ok. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Served our purpose, but needs some help.”
Reviews.Author: PegPowell
Reviews.Content: Our room was fine, although we did have to have three things corrected. Our keys didn't work, there was a leak in the tub, and one of the TV remotes didn't work. These problems were taken care of promptly. We had a very nice dinner in the restaurant, and the breakfast was would I expect from Embassy Suites. The elevator sounds positively ancient. Was going to use the hot tub, but there were no pool towels available. I went to the front desk and was told they would have housekeeping bring some right away. I gave up after half an hour. The grounds were very pretty and seemed well kept, but I think they need to step up in several other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Aging property okay for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: lac14
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Embassy Suites Greenway several times for business. It is a reasonably convenient place for business, as the other Hilton Properties in the area (Tapatio, Squaw peak) are sprawled out and set up more for vacation travelers. However the property is aging. Often I cannot get the hot water to work properly, and some of the rooms seem to bother my allergies. However the staff is friendly, the breakfast is as you expect from an Embassy Suites, and overall the experience is okay as long as you are not expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, first impressions, especially when you're tired, are better left unsaid”
Reviews.Author: Alharlow
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review, before the sun came up, and before I really had a chance to see what the facility was all about. I regret writing that review and have looked for ways I can change it or delete it, because it was just unfair. My wife and I woke up late and rush off to breakfast right at closing time. The omelet chef was extremely nice and reopened his station for us and cooked us two sensational omelets. Then we asked the front to change our room near the pool and make an adjustment on our bill, and she was extremely accommodating. Now we're in a much better room on the first floor (which I would recommend), by the pool, looking into the courtyard, (which I would also recommend). Everyone here is extremely nice and the carpeting in this room is much better, and the bathroom is not as tiny. The bottom line is that we have not found anything as reasonably priced for what you get here, in comparison, in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. My opinion has changed. It's a good deal and they are willing to work with you here to make things better. My wife is now happier, and this is good. She can hang out by the pool while I work. Still, check the reviews on this site and others before going ANYWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldAngel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a convention. The front desk staff were VERY courteous. Ruth put a rush on my room's readiness with housekeeping and it was ready within 30 minutes. The room was a fine but there were stains on the carpet. The floor was uneven as it inclined at the front door, which caused me to trip a couple of times, which is not good for someone with low vision. The carpet was not marked to reflect this unevenness. The walkways around the rooms were also uneven and often difficult to navigate for someone with low vision. When I tried to take a nap, I saw a 1/2 inch long white bug crawling in my bed. Other convention attendees had other kinds of bugs but were told they would "go away" by staff. On the last day, we ran out of toilet paper. On the good side, the staff I dealt with was VERY nice and helpful. Giovanni in the restaurant went out of his way to serve us well. The food, especially the breakfast, was excellent. The meeting facilities were top notch and the serving staff and bartenders were competent and obliging. The property was gorgeous and very relaxing and I thoroughly enjoyed the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: Timmer2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a conference and were underwhelmed by our room. It had two TVs, both of which were fuzzy and had remotes that barely worked (some buttons were simply dead). The tub was so small that I fear even a 5 year old would overflow it trying to bathe. Four out of five pillows were hard and old, the drawers on both bedside tables would spontaneously open and the doors to the main closet fell off. The main lobby is quite nice, and the restaurant, Lafitte's, was delicious and well-priced. The pool is nice, but there were no umbrellas on any of the tables which I found weird considering the scorching 100 degree sun. Basically this is a once-amazing hotel that has aged and gone into disrepair a bit. If they were to reno the rooms, and upgrade, they could return to prominence as a choice hotel. Until they do overhaul though, I would recommend against a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired, noting works”
Reviews.Author: comag
Reviews.Content: Great location for business, nice facilities, but TERRIBLE hotel -- old, dirty, no wireless, wired did not work in first room, loud noises and strange sounds emanate from the walls .... I travel a LOT (three nights a week) and this one is pretty terrible. And, oh, did I point out that the hotel staff, while nice are not competent ... Add that to the 6-7 security guards wandering around and it makes for a truly restful business trip. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Dated”
Reviews.Author: hogie49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy Suites for our last night in Arizona before returning home to Michigan. The gounds are lovely. Our room faced the pool which was nice but rather noisy at night.Our room was clean but very dated. The furniture was old and the sofa was very uncomfortable to sit on. The location was nice and close to many restaurants. We found the front desk staff very accomodating and friendly. I can't say much for the Happy Hour though. The "hot" snacks consisted of melted Cheez Whiz and some tiny egg rolls and chips and salsa. Not worth the walk to the lobby. All in all it is not a bad place and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: Dave493
Reviews.Content: This is a great family hotel. The all suite hotel is very family friendly. They have a huge pool and large grassy courtyard. The included full breakfast was one of the best we have encountered. We also enjoyed the 2 hour "happy hour" each evening. On several occaisions we took advantage of the happy hour and picknicked in the outdoor courtyard with our extended family for the evening meal. The only slight negative would be housekeeping. We stayed 9 nights and the housheeping service was inconsistant. On several occasions they took the dirty towels but did not leave a full compliment of clean ones. We also had a problem with a dripping tap that was not fixed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: brewhawk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was filthy from top to bottom, including the motel-style rooms and common areas. We had large stains on the walls and ceilings. Housekeeping was shoddy at best. The highway was noisy, the desk staff and management were rude and argumentative, the customer service very poor at every level, and the restaurant below average in quality and service. This place is WAY below normal Embassy Suites standards, so don't be fooled by the name. This is a poorly managed property from top to bottom. It was a huge disappointment. I recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatchersMom
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property just off I-17 on Greenway Road. Easy access to all parts of Phoenix. Breakfast every morning is fresh, and omelets are wonderful. Only small problem is the wait if they are busy, but that is to be expected. Front desk folks are very professional and personable, except for the one exception I ran into on the late night shift. Pool and tennis courts are wondeful, and the entire property is very well maintained. We did have one problem with a noise in the pipes in the bathroom every morning. They offered to move us, but we were so busy with baseball Spring Training, we didn't have time to move. When I checked out, I suggested that they have someone sleep in the room to hear the noises we heard, as engineering could not identify the noise when it wasn't happening. The front desk gentleman listened to my suggestion (not a complaint), then handed me my bill. He had dropped my rate by $50 and taken off the night I had the problem with the night personnel. (The problem was a vehicle outside our room that had left it's lights on, shining into our room. ) This was, by far, the most enjoyable visit I have ever had at a Hilton property, and will definitely return to stay for Spring Training next year.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel- but nothing special. i would not pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for business in March. check in was okay- I got a 3rd floor room which was needed with the motel style doors for me to feel safe. the room was fine- nothing great. it was spacious as all embassy suites are but the bathroom was a bit dated and the whole room felt dingy. Also, the router for high speed internet was by the couch not near the table area so it was not great for efficiently working in the room. breakfast was good. the omelet/pancake station was effcient and the worker was very pleasant! they have plenty of other choices too. check out was uneventful too. i ran around the hotel instead of using the fitness center or running off the property. it is `0.5 miles each trip around the outer edge of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: MichWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times now...The hotel is slightly dated, and I don't really like outside-access room (where your door opens to the outdoors instead of to a hallway), but with the rooms I've been given here, I can hardly complain...As a Hilton Gold member, I've always been upgraded here to a GIANT 2-story suite...The layout is amazing. I shared the room with a friend from Grad School and we could have gone without seeing each other for days inside this room! Internet worked great, the room was clean (although not the most modern I've had). The included breakfast was good, although it's a bit of a pain getting to your room...The property is several unconnected buildings...If you can't get parking in front of your building, it can be a hike to your door. But I'll come back again and again--hopefully getting the two-story room again!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms but good extras”
Reviews.Author: travelinmomof3
Reviews.Content: This could be a great place if they would clean the rooms. Our first room was one on the freeway side (very noisy) and was obviously dirty. Plastic wrappers other assorted bit of things on the carpet everywhere but the candy beside the bed was the clincher. Moved rooms to the next building facing the courtyard and pool. This is definitely the side to request. This room was slightly better in the center of the room but when we opened the sofabed - DISGUSTING under there. There was some type of white substance smeared across the front of the TV control panel and on the remote. Other "stuff" on the arms of the sofa. Yuck. I assumed if you can't get a clean room out of 2, three is not likely any better so we cleaned the tv and put up with the debris under the sofabed. The rest of the place is nice, the courtyard and pool area. Excellent breakfast included. There was also a great dinner special in Lafitte's, and the service was excellent. Overpriced for the dirty rooms, so I would suggest a request for a thorough cleaning when you book. Too bad because this could be a great place - but I probably would think twice before I stayed again.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE experience TWICE !!!!! BAD management.”
Reviews.Author: beezmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April 2007. We were in town for a Nascar race and arrived at our room late at night. Our room was cold, and they had NO heat and had to bring in a portable space heater. There was NO hot water, so we had a maintenence man in our room at 1AM working on the bathtub. We ordered room service right before they closed and they forgot part of our order and we could not call them to get it because they left !! The manager Greg promised to make it up to us if we visited again. So in November we again came for Nascar and again checked in to our room to find NO hot water and hair in the tub !!! We immediately checked out and stayed ay the Marriott Courtyard down the street. (wonderful) To this day neither Greg the manager nor Rick the General Manager has followed up on our complaints. BAD Management, BAD, dirty uncomfortable accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Old, dated, dirty, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Calartist
Reviews.Content: I like to stay at Embassy Suites, and have been very happy. Unfortunately, this place was a HUGE disappointment. It is old, dirty, dated. The carpeting was stained, and the furniture was cheap looking and dirty. It is located next to the busy freeway, with outdoor hallways. The main lobby building has an odor like gas. When I saw my room, I complained to the front desk and they escorted me to another room down the corridor. It was worse. It smelled like cigarette smoke, even though it was "non-smoking." The bed spread had a cigarette burn hole in it. The third room they took me to was slightly better, so I stayed there. They admit this hotel was bought from another chain. It reminded me of Motel 6. They say they are do for a major renovation. Before that, I would stay away from this place--you will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: BleednBlu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a fastpitch softball team. The hotel is very nice and we loved the extra place and we were here for 6 days. The breakfast was good and the overall price was great. Only problem was a rule against youth swimming after 10pm. The pool was not right outside anyone's rooms and it was summer vacation and very hot. We had just finished a game and the girls wanted a swim with us adults present. The guard kicked the girls (just 4 of them with two adults) out of the pool. Other than that, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Embassy Suite level”
Reviews.Author: elmo218
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at this Embassy Suite was quite horrible. I have stayed at Embassy Suites many times, but have never expereinced one like this. This hotel is at the same level of a one start motel. First of all when you arrive to the main lobby, there is a musty smell. After the second day, you start to get used it, but it defintely smells old. The hotel room was not very pleasent. The carpet had several noticable stains around the room. The ceiling had two buldged areas that looked like they could come down soon. The room also smelled old and musty. The room floor was slanted. It was the strangest thing, all of the rooms seemed to be slanted down. As well as the walk way surrounding the pool area, as if the hotel had started sink. To make matters worse, I was offered a free movie in my room and when I was ready to view it, the TV could not show any movies. When the service person arrived, he tried for a few minutes, then said, "sorry nothing I can do, good night". The pool area is decsent. However, I ordered several drinks for my family, pina colada and strawberry daquries and they were all very wattered down. It had no tast to it at all. The breakfast was good and some of the workers at the food area where very nice and helpfull. This hotel should not be rated a three star hotel. It is very old and should be refurbished ASAP. It is not on par with the Embassy Suites hotels that I have come to know. Please know that I have stayed in many hotels and travel often and this is the first time that I take the time to comment. I would decided on another Embassy Suites. If you like Hilton, then try the Hilton Garden Inn, these are newer hotels and have similar breakfast at most of their hotels (howerver not alwasy free as Embassy Suites). Hope this is helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Btrtrvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here iin late May as we were attending a wedding reception at the hotel. The front desk was very cordial and helpful. We arrived shortly after noon due to an early flight arrival. They were able to give us several room choices and we relaxed on the grounds. Enjoyed the cocktails in the evening and breakfast on the deck. The room, facing the courtyard, was large and comfortable. We were far from the front area, but like that so we could take a walk. Beautiful, well maintained grounds. We sat around the pool and although did not swim, we enjoyed all of what was going on. This hotel is easy to find and close to the freeway. We have not stayed at an Embassy Suite before, but after this nice experience would check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: honeyb2
Reviews.Content: Wanted a hotel on the north side of Phoenix so we could fly in during the evening and begin our trip to the Grand Canyon in the morning without having to deal with too much traffic. We were so impressed with the lovely grounds that included a beautiful pool and tennis courts. Clean, quiet and comfortable rooms, very easy getting on and off the interstate. Great free made to order breakfast that you can take out out on the patio and eat overlooking the pool. If I wanted something near the airport, I would still go with the Best Western Papago Inn, since it is such a nice hotel for so little money. But for the north of Phoenix, I loved the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: alsnapa
Reviews.Content: We have actually stayed at this hotel many, many times. The pool is fantasic for families, because there is a child's pool, shallow and in the shade. The jacuzzi is large, can accomodate large parties. The rooms are huge, nice if you are staying several days. The buffet breakfast is the best...made to order omlettes, fresh fruit, tons of meat/side dishes. And every afternoon are cocktails...free of charge! Enjoy the pool and drink up!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Value”
Reviews.Author: MetMan
Reviews.Content: Finding good hotels within my companies budget is getting more difficult all the time. This particular Embassy Suites has solved that problem for me in Phoenix. Although it is not that close to Scottsdale, the amenities were more than a fair trade off for the additonal drive time. Just make sure you don't have an outside room near I-17 and you'll be fine. For $129, which was my companies rate, I got a wonderful suite, full size fridge and microwave. LIving room, kitchen table, separate vanity/bath and shower. Very spacious. There is a huge inner courtyard with a shallow 3 foot pool, but it's still okay to do modest laps in. The pool is very big, and a nice hot tub too. The restaurant is Cajun/New Orleans style. Room service was the fastest ever, and prices for room service were affordable enough that I could afford to eat in my room on my per diem. I had a petite Prime Rib for $12.95 which was huge, with sweet potato souffle, mixed vegetables, bread and salad! A nice spacious lobby area, and the breakfast has cooked to order eggs and pancakes as well. Simply a really great deal in Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this place!”
Reviews.Author: NYCowboy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with the usual Embassy amenities. Pool is very nice, rooms were very clean, bed comfortable, resturant was good although slow service, even though the hotel was sold out I was never disturbed by outside noises.

HotelInfo.Name: Embassy Suites Hotel Phoenix-North
HotelInfo.Address: 2577 W Greenway Road, Phoenix, AZ 85023
